alert.note: Alert for Columbia (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 11 at 7:30AM CDT until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arkansas and northwest Louisiana, including the following county and parishes, in southwest Arkansas, Columbia. In northwest Louisiana, Claiborne and Webster. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 730 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Haynesville, Emerson, Atlanta, Village, Calhoun, Noxobe, Spotville, Ebenezer, Laughlin and Medlock. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
